title: Career Coaching for University Graduates or College Graduates
author: Brian Epstein

key_facts: Brian Epstein is a career coach with over 20 years of experience helping people advance their careers.
Career coaching covers all stages of a professional journey, from graduation to executive leadership.
Brian works with individuals who are uncertain about their next steps after completing college or university.
He helps clients assess their skills, identify passions, and align them with market opportunities.
He assists with resume writing, cover letter development, LinkedIn profile optimization, and interview preparation.
Brian emphasizes the importance of networking as a key strategy for job seekers at any career stage.
He conducts collaborative resume revisions based on client-provided accomplishments and experiences.
He provides interview coaching through role-playing and visualization techniques to build confidence.
He supports clients in negotiating job offers and integrating into new workplaces successfully.
He offers a free 30-minute consultation to evaluate compatibility between coach and client.
His services include guidance on postgraduate education decisions and alternative career paths.
He helps clients understand how to present their background effectively in the Canadian job market.
He focuses on both technical skills and soft skills like communication and cultural fit in organizations.
He works with clients across all age groups, including those returning to education later in life.
He helps clients tailor their applications to specific companies by researching organizational needs.
key_opinions: Many graduates have unrealistic expectations about landing jobs immediately after graduation.
Copying a resume directly onto LinkedIn is not an effective way to build a strong personal brand.
Lack of self-reflection is one of the biggest mistakes new graduates make when starting their careers.
Networking is more valuable than mass resume submissions for securing meaningful employment.
Confidence during interviews stems from preparation and positive mental visualization.
Employers value cultural fit and communication skills as much as technical expertise.
A career coach provides objective perspective and emotional support during job search stress.
Clients benefit most from active collaboration rather than passive instruction.
Understanding the job market is essential before choosing between further education or job hunting.
The first job doesn't need to be the perfect long-term career path, but it should be strategically chosen.
Job seekers should avoid accepting the first offer without evaluating its alignment with goals.
Success in career advancement requires ongoing self-assessment and market awareness.
People often underestimate the impact of personal branding on hiring outcomes.
Coaching helps reduce anxiety by creating clear, actionable steps in the job search process.
Building a strong narrative around oneâ€™s experience increases visibility and credibility.
key_datapoints: Brian Epstein has been working as a career coach for over 20 years.
He offers a free 30-minute consultation to prospective clients.
He helps clients with resume, cover letter, LinkedIn, and interview preparation.
He supports clients in negotiating job offers and integrating into new workplaces.
He works with individuals at all career stages, from recent graduates to executives.
He assists clients in assessing skills, identifying passions, and matching them to market demand.
He emphasizes the importance of researching industries and organizations before applying.
He uses role-playing and visualization techniques to prepare clients for interviews.
He helps clients tailor their applications to specific companies and roles.
He guides clients through the entire job search lifecycle, including post-offer integration.
He collaborates with clients on every aspect of their application materials.
He helps clients understand how to present their background in a compelling way.
He supports clients in making informed decisions about continuing education.
He helps clients build a narrative that goes beyond listing job duties.
He focuses on helping clients demonstrate value to employers beyond technical qualifications.
